data.title: Wiktionary, the free dictionary
data.text:
espera

third-person singular present indicative of esperar

second-person singular imperative of esperar

IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [əsˈpe.ɾə]

IPA(key): (Valencia) [esˈpe.ɾa]

espera

inflection of esperar:

third-person singular present indicative

second-person singular imperative

espera

inflection of esperar:

third-person singular present indicative

second-person singular imperative

Rhymes: -ɛɾɐ

Hyphenation: es‧pe‧ra

Deverbal from esperar. From Old Galician-Portuguese esperar (“to wait; to hope”), from Latin spērāre (“to hope; to await”), from Proto-Indo-European *speh₁- (“to prosper, to turn out well”).

espera f (plural esperas)

wait (time spent waiting)

ambush (wait for someone in order to attack them)

espera

inflection of esperar:

third-person singular present indicative

second-person singular imperative

IPA(key): /esˈpeɾa/ [esˈpe.ɾa]

Rhymes: -eɾa

Syllabification: es‧pe‧ra

Deverbal from esperar.

espera f (plural esperas)

wait

sala de espera ― waiting room

espera

inflection of esperar:

third-person singular present indicative

second-person singular imperative
